SEARCH
Package supplier

Class Supplier_OrderManagementController

java.lang.Object
supplier.Supplier_OrderManagementController
public class Supplier_OrderManagementController extends Object
Controller class for managing orders for a supplier in the restaurant's management GUI.
Version:
August 2024
Author:
Kfir Amoyal, Noam Furman, Israel Ohayon, Eitan Zerbel, Yaniv Shatil, Omri Heit

    • loadRestaurantOrders

      public void loadRestaurantOrders(BiteOptions returendOrdersNoam)
      Loads the restaurant orders into the table after receiving them from the server.
      Parameters:
      returendOrdersNoam - The response containing the orders from the server.

    • setOrders

      public void setOrders(javafx.collections.ObservableList<RestaurantOrders> orders)
      Sets the list of restaurant orders and updates the order table.

      This method takes an ObservableList of RestaurantOrders, assigns it to the resOrders field, and then sets this list as the items for the orderTable. After updating, it prints a confirmation message to the console.

      Parameters:
      orders - An ObservableList of RestaurantOrders to be set and displayed. This list will replace any existing orders in the table.

    • settUserDitales

      public void settUserDitales(User receivedUser)
      Sets the user details and simulates sending a message to the user.
      Parameters:
      receivedUser - The user details received from the server.

    • simulateMessageSending

      public void simulateMessageSending(String recipient, String subject, String message)
      Simulates sending a message by showing an alert with the details.
      Parameters:
      recipient - The recipient's email address.
      subject - The subject of the message.
      message - The content of the message.

    • changeStatus

      public void changeStatus(RestaurantOrders newStatRes)
      Sends a request to the server to change the status of an order.
      Parameters:
      newStatRes - The order with the new status.
